name: lacerated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
medical
  formal or specialized (especially of flesh) cut or torn: He was taken to hospital with a leg so badly lacerated that it had to be amputated. a lacerated liver
literary feeling great emotional pain: As the months went by, her lacerated heart slowly mended.
More examplesFewer examplesHis tongue was so lacerated that he could not speak.She suffered a fractured skull and a lacerated spleen.At the end of the climb I had lacerated hands and bruised knuckles.I did not know how to carry on with a heart so broken and lacerated.
